snippet: The last time the U.S. Open was contested at the Olympic Club, Casey Martin had successfully sued for the right to use a cart in a golf tournament. His return this year is a confluence of diligence and destiny.
abstract: Casey Martin is back in the United States Open golf tournament at the Olympic Club, after six years away from competition; returns to same course where, 14 years earlier, he successfully sued for the right to use a cart in a golf tournament; other golf items noted.

byline.original: By BILL PENNINGTON and KAREN CROUSE

lead_paragraph: The last time the U.S. Open was contested at the Olympic Club, Casey Martin had successfully sued for the right to use a cart in a golf tournament. His return this year is a confluence of diligence and destiny.

headline.seo: Casey Martin Returns to the U.S. Open, Where a Cart Is Waiting
headline.main: Martin Returns to Open, Where a Cart Is Waiting
headline.print_headline: Warmth, Not Controversy, Marks Return to the Open
